about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: When passing, you should move back into the right lane when:

about.name: When passing, you should move back into the right lane when:

hasPart.assesses: When passing, you should move back into the right lane when: | When passing, you should move back into the right lane when: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Do not pass unless you have enough space to return to the driving lane. Before you return to the driving lane, be sure you have enough room between yourself and the vehicle you have passed. When you can see both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror, it is safe to return to the driving lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: You are one vehicle length ahead of the passed vehicle.

comment.text: You are one vehicle length ahead of the passed vehicle.

suggestedAnswer.text: You can see both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.

comment.text: You can see both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.

suggestedAnswer.text: You are 50 feet ahead of the passed vehicle.

comment.text: You are 50 feet ahead of the passed vehicle.

acceptedAnswer.text: You can see both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.

comment.text: You can see both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.

answerExplanation.text: Do not pass unless you have enough space to return to the driving lane. Before you return to the driving lane, be sure you have enough room between yourself and the vehicle you have passed. When you can see both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror, it is safe to return to the driving lane.

comment.text: When passing, you should move back into the right lane when: | Do not pass unless you have enough space to return to the driving lane. Before you return to the driving lane, be sure you have enough room between yourself and the vehicle you have passed. When you can see both headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror, it is safe to return to the driving lane.

hasPart.name: Double solid yellow lane markings mean that:

about.name: Double solid yellow lane markings mean that:

hasPart.assesses: Double solid yellow lane markings mean that: | Double solid yellow lane markings mean that: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Yellow lane markings indicate a separation of lanes where traffic is traveling in opposite directions. When you see double solid yellow lane markings, passing is prohibited from both directions.

comment.text: Neither lane may pass.
Both lanes may pass.

suggestedAnswer.text: The lane to the right may pass.

comment.text: The lane to the right may pass.
Neither lane may pass.

answerExplanation.text: Yellow lane markings indicate a separation of lanes where traffic is traveling in opposite directions. When you see double solid yellow lane markings, passing is prohibited from both directions.

comment.text: Double solid yellow lane markings mean that: | Yellow lane markings indicate a separation of lanes where traffic is traveling in opposite directions. When you see double solid yellow lane markings, passing is prohibited from both directions.

hasPart.name: If the driver of an oncoming vehicle fails to dim their headlights:

about.name: If the driver of an oncoming vehicle fails to dim their headlights:

hasPart.assesses: If the driver of an oncoming vehicle fails to dim their headlights: | If the driver of an oncoming vehicle fails to dim their headlights: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If an oncoming driver fails to dim their headlights, look toward the right side of the road. This will keep you from being blinded by the other vehicle’s headlights and allow you to see enough of the road to stay on course. Do not try to retaliate by keeping your bright lights on.

suggestedAnswer.text: Look toward the center of the roadway.

comment.text: Look toward the center of the roadway.

suggestedAnswer.text: Look toward the right side of the road.

comment.text: Look toward the right side of the road.
Look straight ahead.

acceptedAnswer.text: Look toward the right side of the road.

comment.text: Look toward the right side of the road.

answerExplanation.text: If an oncoming driver fails to dim their headlights, look toward the right side of the road. This will keep you from being blinded by the other vehicle’s headlights and allow you to see enough of the road to stay on course. Do not try to retaliate by keeping your bright lights on.

comment.text: If the driver of an oncoming vehicle fails to dim their headlights: | If an oncoming driver fails to dim their headlights, look toward the right side of the road. This will keep you from being blinded by the other vehicle’s headlights and allow you to see enough of the road to stay on course. Do not try to retaliate by keeping your bright lights on.

hasPart.name: This sign means:
hasPart.assesses: This sign means: | This sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: This sign warns of a dangerous downgrade or hill ahead. The hill may be very long or steep, or it may have sharp curves.

comment.text: Upcoming downgrade or hill.
Road construction area.
Upcoming narrowing of roadway.
Upcoming downgrade or hill.

answerExplanation.text: This sign warns of a dangerous downgrade or hill ahead. The hill may be very long or steep, or it may have sharp curves.

hasPart.name: When driving under low-visibility conditions due to fog, you should:

about.name: When driving under low-visibility conditions due to fog, you should:

hasPart.assesses: When driving under low-visibility conditions due to fog, you should: | When driving under low-visibility conditions due to fog, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When driving in fog, you should slow down and use your low beam lights. If the fog is so dense that you cannot see, pull off the road and wait for the fog to clear.

suggestedAnswer.text: Turn on your high beam headlights.

comment.text: Turn on your high beam headlights.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down and use your low beam headlights.

comment.text: Slow down and use your low beam headlights.

suggestedAnswer.text: Increase your speed so you do not cause an accident.

comment.text: Increase your speed so you do not cause an accident.

acceptedAnswer.text: Slow down and use your low beam headlights.

comment.text: Slow down and use your low beam headlights.

answerExplanation.text: When driving in fog, you should slow down and use your low beam lights. If the fog is so dense that you cannot see, pull off the road and wait for the fog to clear.

comment.text: When driving under low-visibility conditions due to fog, you should: | When driving in fog, you should slow down and use your low beam lights. If the fog is so dense that you cannot see, pull off the road and wait for the fog to clear.

hasPart.name: This sign is used to warn drivers that:

about.name: This sign is used to warn drivers that:

hasPart.assesses: This sign is used to warn drivers that: | This sign is used to warn drivers that: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers that the number of lanes is reduced ahead and that traffic should merge left.

suggestedAnswer.text: The right lane is ending and traffic should merge left.

comment.text: The right lane is ending and traffic should merge left.
The road curves ahead.
There are upcoming intersections.

acceptedAnswer.text: The right lane is ending and traffic should merge left.

comment.text: The right lane is ending and traffic should merge left.

answerExplanation.text: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. They alert you to conditions that are immediately ahead. This sign warns drivers that the number of lanes is reduced ahead and that traffic should merge left.
